website_summaries.verdict: Customers wanting a simple and attractive waterproof jacket will appreciate this reliable model.
pros: Nylon and polyester materials completely waterproof
Hood and hemline work on a drawstring for excellent weather protection
cons: Some owners claimed the newer model of the jacket is lower quality than previous versions of the same product

customer_reviews.title: Not watertight nor water proof
customer_reviews.text: Columbia Men's Watertight II Front-Zip Hooded. To say that this jacket is watertight or water proof is a complete misrepresentation. The rain soaks right through. I am going to try to get a refund. Worst rain wear I have ever purchased.
customer_reviews.author: Recycled

customer_reviews.title: Good value, quality and proper size
customer_reviews.text: Not as fancy as some others, but it has clean lines (without contrasting color blocks or huge logos) and is lightweight. This jacket is a good "dress" rain jacket. It does have the hood, of course, but it would be more appropriate for town, out for dinner, etc. than a more trail/sport jacket. I was concerned about the size as I usually find medium sizes too short in the sleeves and larges too loose in the chest. Tall sizes are overkill for me. I'm longer in the arms than torso. However, I ordered the medium and the sleeve length is fine. Fits perfectly for me (YMMV).
customer_reviews.author: webvex

customer_reviews.title: Seems like a good jacket but really doesn't fit to size
customer_reviews.text: Seems like a good jacket but really doesn't fit to size. In men's cloths my wife normally wears XL and I wear XXL. She could barely get the XL on and did not fit her hips at all.. The XXL was uncomfortably tight on me wearing a heavy flannel shirt over a tee shirt. the XXL for me fit her about the same way most of her XL jackets and sweatshirts fit. Would strongly advise buying one size up to get normal fit for activewear.
customer_reviews.author: R. S. Morgan

customer_reviews.title: Ordered a M, it's a little bit bigger than ...
customer_reviews.text: Ordered a M, it's a little bit bigger than a standard M jacket, but that gives it versatility to fit over whatever you might be wearing; sweaters/light jackets included. Doesn't look ridiculous if you're just wearing a t-shirt either. I'm 5'9" 155lbs. Looks well made.
customer_reviews.author: Z. Cavaricci

customer_reviews.title: I DO NOT BUY COLUMBIA ANYMORE! I SWITCHED TO UNDER ARMOR FOR QUALITY AND CUSTOMER SERVICE.
customer_reviews.text: Nice jacket until I wore it the 2nd time then the zipper broke. I'm a 100% disabled vet in a wheelchair and I bought this in case I ever got caught in the rain. Well one day I did and the cheap zipper broke! I was one day out of being able to return it to Amazon. And Columbia customer support never answered my email. Switch to Under Amour as I have. Columbia used to be my favorite brand but no more. $45 down the drain on this piece of junk.
customer_reviews.author: Dave Gisriel

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Light-weight Rain Jacket
customer_reviews.text: Just got this jacket yesterday, and it's awesome!! Fits great, looks good, feels good, and it seems very well constructed. I was looking for a quality light-weight rain jacket that doesn't make me too hot, and I am happy to have found this jacket. Also, if I need more warmth, I'm able to wear a jacket underneath it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon414

customer_reviews.title: Not Exactly What I Wanted
customer_reviews.text: I am 5'10 and 200lbs. I was hoping that this could be my new rain jacket for Spring in Western Washington state. I usually wear an XL, but this jacket didn't fit like an XL. It fit more like a Large. Additionally, it didn't have inside pockets which I like to have in my jackets. I ordered the Super Sonic (Orange). Amazon is awesome for the returns, so now I have to find another jacket that will suit my needs.
customer_reviews.author: TranquilEyes

customer_reviews.title: Delicate Fabric
customer_reviews.text: Good jacket overall, keeps the water out without making you sweat. My one complaint with this jacket is the exterior fabric is really delicate. I bought one and it was delivered with a snag on the front pocket. Thinking it was a defect, I exchanged it for another one. The second one was fine for a while but then snagged when I brushed up against a wall. Not sure if that would be covered by the warranty or not, but Im hoping. I would expect paying $50+ for a jacket would mean it would last longer than 10 months.
customer_reviews.author: Melanie

customer_reviews.title: Very nice jacket. However
customer_reviews.text: Very nice jacket. However, I'm puzzled as how it folds into the hand pocket as described in your description. There were no instructions and nothing mentioned on the tag about that feature of packing.
customer_reviews.author: S. Weeks

customer_reviews.title: I'd like to tell you its because of my bulging biceps
customer_reviews.text: I am not a Big guy, 6'3" 180 lbs. I could not get my arm in the sleeve past the elbow. I'd like to tell you its because of my bulging biceps, but sadly no. Returned quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Fledgling

customer_reviews.title: Quality
customer_reviews.text: Pleasantly surprised. Fits great and compacts into a front pocket that zips closed. Not tiny but packable.
customer_reviews.author: Obiwan

customer_reviews.title: Nice all purpose jacket!
customer_reviews.text: Quality made, waterproof jacket. Cinder color looks great and exactly like photo. Very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: jzondo

customer_reviews.title: This product is definitely light and watertight as demonstrated during ...
customer_reviews.text: This product is definitely light and watertight as demonstrated during a trip to Iceland during which it rained for 12 out of 14 days. I would have given it 5 stars had it been more breathable and had the zipper operation been smoother. Once in a while, the zipper would catch at the bottom as it was being zipped up.
customer_reviews.author: GJ

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: Great jacket. Water runs right off. I tend to run small/medium. I got this jacket in a medium and I wear it over a fairly snug down jacket. I was relieved that the jacket is loose enough to fit comfortably over the down layer. It packs easily, though getting the zipper to actually close can be tough. That's not really necessary since it's compact enough even unzipped.
customer_reviews.author: coffee drinker

customer_reviews.title: This is great! I thought it would be a little bigger ...
customer_reviews.text: This is great! I thought it would be a little bigger because it's a raincoat, but it fits just like the other Columbia items I have.
customer_reviews.author: RR

customer_reviews.title: Runs Big
customer_reviews.text: Ordered a Medium and it fit like a Large. Quality looked good though.
customer_reviews.author: FF

customer_reviews.title: The jacket is nicely made and thought out
customer_reviews.text: I originally ordered a medium due to a few reviews. It fit, but was too snug with more than a T-shirt or lungs full of air ;-) Lg fits normal, imo. The jacket is nicely made and thought out. Pockets are deep and the jacket folds up nicely in the pockets.
customer_reviews.author: MikeF

customer_reviews.title: it's too lager for me
customer_reviews.text: 165cm, 55kg,somewhat tiny body,this Columbia jacket is too large for me .
customer_reviews.author: eric

customer_reviews.title: FAKE Jacket!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I was planning on getting this as a gift. I saw another reviewer say the jacket they received was a fake, but I didn't believe them since every other review was glowing. BUT, I should've listened to them... THIS IS A FAKE JACKET! Clearly in the pictures, the logo should be embroidered, but the logo is a STICKER on the jacket I received!! That's NOT authentic. It also doesn't say "Packable" either! I'm incredibly DISAPPOINTED! I'm definitely returning this.
customer_reviews.author: Lindsay

customer_reviews.title: Great Lighweight Jacket, but Be Sure to Size Up
customer_reviews.text: I recently received this as a gift for use hiking and walking my dogs during colder months. As other reviewers have noted, it's a snug fit; I'm a large framed guy measuring in at 6'2" and 205-pounds with a 46 inch chest and 36-inch waist. I initially got an XL, but returned it for a XXL because the jacket was a bit too tight in the shoulders and I didn't feel like I could layer anything under it if I needed too. Size issues, aside, it's a great jacket perfect for cooler fall days or as an outer layer when the weather gets really cold. This will definitely be in my pack during future day hikes and backpacking trips.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Junkie

customer_reviews.title: Easily on and off as the day warmed up and ...
customer_reviews.text: I just purchased this item for my husband. I own a red one and lived in it for 2 weeks fishing in Canada. The hood came up and stayed in place in the wind when motoring across the lakes. I could have put extra clothes on under it, but it broke the wind perfectly and was warm enough for the 55 to 80 degree weather. Easily on and off as the day warmed up and so packable. I'm going to have to wash it, but for all the fish guts that hit it, it still smells decent. (can't say that about the fish handling gloves!!) I LOVE this jacket.
customer_reviews.author: JD

customer_reviews.title: Not Fake
customer_reviews.text: The jacket definitely is a standard fit, the small is baggy on me. That being said, I have seen a lot of complaints warning everyone that the Colombia sticker vs embroidered is how to tell a fake. But like someone else on here I went to my local stores to check. I went to both Kohls and a sporting good store. Both had this Watertight II Rain Jacket with the Colombia lettering with a sticker. It's not fake just design change in the product. Contact Colombia sales if you have questions.
customer_reviews.author: Cyclical

customer_reviews.title: Whoa!  Columbia quality is heading in the wrong direction
customer_reviews.text: This product is inferior in every way to the 2012 version of the same product:. The 2012 version had better material, zipper snaps (not velcro), nice zipper, chest pocket, great attention to detail in the stitching and lining, ... Columbia management values have obviously shifted from quality to profit-margins. This means I can no longer trust the Columbia BRAND to be the top quality product that I had always expected and will consider other brands in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Camera Shy

customer_reviews.title: It is perfect for the weather we have in California where it ...
customer_reviews.text: My daughter gave this to me as a gift. It is perfect for the weather we have in California where it is not too cold. My son borrowed it for a couple of months when he went to Oregon. He used it there all the time and loved it and did not want to give it back. I could not give this one to him as it is a gift from my daughter. Told him I will get him one which I will be doing right now.
customer_reviews.author: Jingo

customer_reviews.title: Nice jacket!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had this jacket for about 3-4 years now. Still holds up nice. And i stay dry. Thinking about ordering more for this winter
customer_reviews.author: Stickmanfishing22

customer_reviews.title: Great Hiking Rain Jacket
customer_reviews.text: This is a great rain jacket for hiking/backpacking, especially when you consider the price of it. It is definitely watertight, as I have been out in torrential rains and not a single bit of water has leaked through. I find the mesh on the inside of the jacket to be extremely comfortable. Also, I love it for its light weight and ability to pack into the pocket, which is great for day hikes or even backcounty week trips. I love Columbia gear, so when I saw this on sale I jumped on it. More than happy I did.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Z

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed for several reasons
customer_reviews.text: I typically like Columbia products. This rain jacket is too tight in the torso, even when only wearing a light shirt underneath. Ordering a size larger might help, but will make the sleeves too long. I'm also disappointed in the use of webbing for the lining in the sleeves: The webbing bunches up and pushes out of the end of the sleeves when you put it on; it is also uncomfortable on bare arms. Lastly, there are only two exterior pockets. If Columbia makes a later "III" version, they should relax the torso fit, use a different lining in the sleeves, and add more pockets.
customer_reviews.author: JEK

customer_reviews.title: I want one just like it.
customer_reviews.text: It fits and works great as a raincoat for me, I love that it had a hood and like many of the other Columbia products,
customer_reviews.author: Ernest Eccles

customer_reviews.title: Now it is useless - I tried recoating but it didn't work well
customer_reviews.text: This jacket stayed waterproof for approximately one year. Now it is useless - I tried recoating but it didn't work well. I recommend buying a Gore-Tex jacket of some kind rather than re-buying jackets like this every other year.
customer_reviews.author: A. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Well made jacket
customer_reviews.text: Great jacket! Very soft and comfortable. Also waterproof which gains it a lot of points
customer_reviews.author: Peter Edick

customer_reviews.title: Wet protection
customer_reviews.text: This is really a good choice to wear for those bad weathers . I can still wear my office attire and yet still keep it not wet from the rain. THis is a must have for those who does not like there clothes to get wet during unexpected rains.
customer_reviews.author: ken147

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: this is a great jacket! keeps me completely dry and it is lightweight, a must have for Oregon
customer_reviews.author: Carson Clow

customer_reviews.title: I am a very active person and I love playing outdoors
customer_reviews.text: I am a very active person and I love playing outdoors. I bought this one and am very impressed by it. I'm not that tall but the jacket fit me just right. It is also very lightweight but is very good at as a waterproof clothing. This is a steal!
customer_reviews.author: Gary Cook

customer_reviews.title: Good value for moderate temps
customer_reviews.text: Not for rainy and freezing cold temperatures. Like the blue model. Fits great.
customer_reviews.author: risenshine

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: Keeps me dry during rainy season. Also regulates body temperature and keeps me warm all the time.
customer_reviews.author: Gary Poehler

customer_reviews.title: Nice jacket
customer_reviews.text: i'm thrilled to have found a jacket like this:covered zipper, ample sleeve closures to be tight at the wrists, tailored hood appearance, and with a light mesh lining for different seasons.
customer_reviews.author: juan llewellyn

customer_reviews.title: Thank you Columbia
customer_reviews.text: I always wear this jacket on my way to the office every morning on my way to the office.
customer_reviews.author: Tormentor

product_meta.title: Columbia Men's Watertight II Front-Zip Hooded Rain Jacket
product_meta.description: Top-notch rain protection in an ultralight package-this packable rain jacket features full seam sealing and a micro porous Omni-tech fabrication that shields you from wet weather while allowing excess heat and vapor to escape during dynamic activity.Center Back Length: 29 inches
feature_bullets: ADVANCED TECHNOLOGY: This Columbia Men's Watertight II Jacket features Omni-Tech waterproof breathable seam-sealed construction for guaranteed protection during rain heavy days outside.
HANDY FEATURES: This waterproof rain jacket features zippered hand pockets, an abrasion resistant chin guard, a drop tail, and a packable contruction for convenience and efficiency.
ADJUSTABLE FEATURES: This shell top waterproof rain jacket features an attached, adjustable storm hood and a drawcord adjustable hem.
CLASSIC FIT: This Men's waterproof rain jacket features a classic fit.
Columbia Men's Watertight II Jacket lives up to its name with it's waterproof, breathable seam-sealed construction and its Omni-Tech tecnology features.
